definition: younger brother/junior male/I (modest word in letter)

sentences.english: The acting skill of the player is not a quarter as good as his professional brothers.
sentences.chinese: 那位演员的演技远远不如他的师兄弟们。

sentences.english: A few division brother that bully Zhang Moji at ordinary times are bullying him again.
sentences.chinese: 几个平时欺负张无忌的师兄弟又在欺负他。

sentences.english: To his astonishment he found his Master and the other disciples sitting there, absorbed in meditation.
sentences.chinese: 他惊讶地发现他的导师和师兄弟都坐在那里冥想。

definition: young disciple (of the same master)/younger or junior male schoolmate
senior male fellow student or apprentice/son (older than oneself) of one's teacher
used for 師傅|师傅 (in Taiwan)/master/qualified worker
junior female student or apprentice/daughter (younger than oneself) of one's teacher
founder (of a craft, religious sect etc)
to keep the law/to protect Buddha's teachings/protector of Buddhist law (i.e. temple donor)
term of respect for your teacher's wife
(of cousins) descending from the same grandfather or great-grandfather
